Question_1.Context: Information about the synthesis of ferulic acid hydrazide derivatives and their inhibitory activity against MAO enzymes.
Question_1.Question: Which compound showed the best inhibitory ability against MAO-B with an IC50 value of 1.88 μM?
Question_1.Source: FA3 had an IC50 value of 1.88 μM, showing the best inhibitory ability against MAO-B.

Question_2.Context: Details about the enzyme kinetics and inhibition studies for MAO-B.
Question_2.Question: What type of inhibitor was FA3 determined to be based on the Lineweaver-Burk plot?
Question_2.Source: In the Lineweaver–Burk plot, FA3 appeared to be a competitive MAO-B inhibitor.

Question_3.Context: Information about the reversibility studies of MAO-B inhibition by FA3.
Question_3.Question: How was the recovery pattern of MAO-B inhibition by FA3 compared to safinamide?
Question_3.A: FA3 showed faster recovery than safinamide
Question_3.B: FA3 showed slower recovery than safinamide
Question_3.C: FA3 showed similar recovery to safinamide
Question_3.D: FA3 did not recover after inhibition
Question_3.Source: The recovery pattern showed FA3 was a reversible MAO-B inhibitor with a similar recovery to safinamide.

Question_4.Context: Details about the molecular docking investigation of FA3 and MAO-B interactions.
Question_4.Question: What was the docking score for the lead compound FA3 in the molecular docking study?
Question_4.Source: The docking scores (XP mode) for the lead compounds (FA3) were approximately -8.591 kcal/mol.

Question_5.Context: Information about the molecular dynamic simulation of the FA3-MAO-B complex.
Question_5.Question: Which amino acid residue showed the highest hydrogen bond contribution with FA3 during the simulation?
Question_5.Source: Gly434 participates in an 84% hydrogen bond with the OH of the ferulic ring.

Question_6.Context: Details about the enzyme assays of MAO-A and MAO-B using specific substrates.
Question_6.Question: Which substrate was used for the enzyme assay of MAO-A?
Question_6.Source: The activities of MAO-A and MAO-B were assayed using kynuramine as substrates.

Question_7.Context: Information about the synthesis of ferulic acid hydrazide derivatives.
Question_7.Question: What was the yield percentage for the synthesis of ferulic acid hydrazide derivative FA9?

Question_8.Context: Details about the spectral characterization of the compounds.
Question_8.Question: Which compound showed a peak at 11.69 ppm in the 1H-NMR spectra indicating the formation of the NH group of hydrazone?
Question_8.Source: In the 1H-NMR spectra of FA1, the peak at 11.69 ppm suggested the formation of the NH group of hydrazone.

Question_9.Context: Information about the enzyme kinetics and inhibition studies for MAO-B.
Question_9.Question: What was used to determine the inhibition type of the leading compound for MAO-B at different substrate concentrations?
Question_9.Source: The inhibition type of the leading compound for MAO-B was determined at the five different substrate concentrations and at three inhibitor concentrations around its IC50 using secondary plots.

Question_10.Context: Details about the enzyme kinetics and inhibition studies for MAO-B.
Question_10.Question: What was the Ki value determined for FA3 in the enzyme kinetics study?
Question_10.Source: The Ki value was determined to be 1.92 ± 0.73 μM.
